headline.main: What’s Lost When Pops Orchestras Tap Pop Culture
headline.print_headline: Trading Pops Classics for Pop Culture

docs.snippet: Under pressure to connect with new audiences, orchestras are employing new tactics, such as forgoing Tchaikovsky for hits by Beyoncé. But at what price?...
docs.abstract: Boston Pops Orchestra is one of growing number of pops orchestras across nation moving away from traditional offerings in effort to draw new and larger audiences; music directors and administrators are experimenting with offerings like live-orchestration film screenings, circus spectacles and even 1990s rock acts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Under pressure to connect with new audiences, orchestras are employing new tactics, such as forgoing Tchaikovsky for hits by Beyoncé. But at what price?

headline.main: Factbox: Troubled Europe Debates Burqas, Niqabs and Burkinis
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Troubled Europe Debates Burqas, Niqabs and Burkinis

docs.snippet: Restrictions on face and full-body veils are back in the spotlight in parts of Europe after some French cities banned the burkini swimsuit, saying the garment, which leaves only the face, hands and feet exposed, defies laws on secularism....
docs.lead_paragraph: Restrictions on face and full-body veils are back in the spotlight in parts of Europe after some French cities banned the burkini swimsuit, saying the garment, which leaves only the face, hands and feet exposed, defies laws on secularism.

headline.main: More U.S. Retailers Probing Phony Egyptian Cotton
headline.print_headline: More U.S. Retailers Probing Phony Egyptian Cotton

docs.snippet: U.S. retailer Bed Bath & Beyond on Wednesday said it ordered an external audit of textiles from Welspun India, after Target Corp last week accused the Indian manufacturer of passing off cheap sheets as premium Egyptian cotton for two years....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. retailer Bed Bath & Beyond on Wednesday said it ordered an external audit of textiles from Welspun India, after Target Corp last week accused the Indian manufacturer of passing off cheap sheets as premium Egyptian cotton for two years.

headline.main: Court Charges Man Who Named Dog After Nigerian President
headline.print_headline: Court Charges Man Who Named Dog After Nigerian President

docs.snippet: A man who wrote the name of Nigeria's president on his dog and paraded the pet in an area where the leader is popular has been charged with breaking the peace....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man who wrote the name of Nigeria's president on his dog and paraded the pet in an area where the leader is popular has been charged with breaking the peace.

headline.main: Scientists Find Earth-Like Planet Circling Sun's Nearest Neighbor
headline.print_headline: Scientists Find Earth-Like Planet Circling Sun's Nearest Neighbor

docs.snippet: Scientists have discovered a planet that appears to be similar to Earth circling the star closest to the sun, potentially a major step in the quest to find out if life exists elsewhere in the universe, research published on Wednesday showed....
docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists have discovered a planet that appears to be similar to Earth circling the star closest to the sun, potentially a major step in the quest to find out if life exists elsewhere in the universe, research published on Wednesday showed.

headline.main: Study: Man-Made Warming May Have Started Decades Earlier
headline.print_headline: Study: Man-Made Warming May Have Started Decades Earlier

docs.snippet: Man-made global warming may have started a few decades earlier than scientists previously figured, a new study suggests....
docs.lead_paragraph: Man-made global warming may have started a few decades earlier than scientists previously figured, a new study suggests.

headline.main: Anti-Pot Initiative Sponsor Gives Up Montana Ballot Effort
headline.print_headline: Anti-Pot Initiative Sponsor Gives Up Montana Ballot Effort

docs.snippet: The sponsor of a proposed initiative to repeal Montana's medical marijuana law said Wednesday he won't appeal a judge's refusal to place the measure on November's ballot, but instead will focus on defeating a separate initiative to expand medical ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The sponsor of a proposed initiative to repeal Montana's medical marijuana law said Wednesday he won't appeal a judge's refusal to place the measure on November's ballot, but instead will focus on defeating a separate initiative to expand medical pot distribution.

headline.main: Orange Denies Media Report on Deal With Vivendi on Telecom Italia
headline.print_headline: Orange Denies Media Report on Deal With Vivendi on Telecom Italia

docs.snippet: French telecoms operator Orange denied on Wednesday having reached a deal with Vivendi that would include taking stakes in the media giant's pay-TV Canal Plus and in Telecom Italia, following an online report by French magazine Challenges....
docs.lead_paragraph: French telecoms operator Orange denied on Wednesday having reached a deal with Vivendi that would include taking stakes in the media giant's pay-TV Canal Plus and in Telecom Italia, following an online report by French magazine Challenges.

headline.main: Turkish Operation in Syria to Continue Until Imminent Threats Neutralized: Official
headline.print_headline: Turkish Operation in Syria to Continue Until Imminent Threats Neutralized: Official

docs.snippet: Turkey will continue operations in Syria, where Turkish tanks, jets and special forces launched an offensive in support of Syrian rebels on Wednesday, until imminent threats to its national security are neutralized, a Turkish official said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey will continue operations in Syria, where Turkish tanks, jets and special forces launched an offensive in support of Syrian rebels on Wednesday, until imminent threats to its national security are neutralized, a Turkish official said.

headline.main: Turkey-Backed Rebels Take Syrian Border Town of Jarablus: State Media
headline.print_headline: Turkey-Backed Rebels Take Syrian Border Town of Jarablus: State Media

docs.snippet: Turkey-backed rebels took control of the Syrian town of Jarablus on Wednesday, state-run Anadolu Agency said, sweeping Islamic State from one its last strongholds on the Syrian-Turkish border....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey-backed rebels took control of the Syrian town of Jarablus on Wednesday, state-run Anadolu Agency said, sweeping Islamic State from one its last strongholds on the Syrian-Turkish border.
